data.title: Kings of France
data.text:
image

Philip IV "the Fair" or "the Iron King", King of France

, b. April/June 1268 in Fontainebleau, France, m. Joan I of Navarre, 16 August 1284, d. 29 November 1314 in Fontainebleau, France

Father: Philip III "the Bold", King of France, b. 30 April 1245 in Poissy, Yvelines, France, d. 5 October 1285 in Perpignan, Languedoc-Roussillon, France

Mother: Isabella of Aragon, b. 1248, d. 28 January 1271, cause of death was injuries resulting from a fall from a horse and stillborn birth

Spouse: Joan I of Navarre, b. 14 January 1273 in Bar-sur-Seine, Champagne, France, d. 2 April 1305 in Cháteau de Vincennes, France

Father: Henry I "the Fat", King of Navarre, b. ABT 1244, d. 22 July 1274 in Pamplona, Navarre, Spain

Mother: Blanche of Artois, b. ABT 1248, m. Edmund "Crouchback", Earl of Lancaster, d. 2 May 1302

Married 1284

Children:

Margaret of France, b. ABT 1288 in Paris, France, d. aft. November 1294 in Paris, France

Louis X "the Quarreler", King of France, b. 4 October 1289 in Paris, France, m. Margaret of Burgundy, 21 September 1305, m. Clementia of Hungary, 19 August 1314, d. 5 June 1316 in Vincennes, Val-de-Marne, France

Blanche of France, b. 1290 in Paris, France, d. aft. 13 April 1294

Philip V "the Tall", King of France, b. ABT 1293 in Lyon, France, m. Joan II of Burgundy, d. 3 January 1322 in Longchamp, France

Charles IV "the Fair", King of France, b. 18/9 June 1294 in Clermont, Oise, France, m. Blanche of Burgundy, 1308, annulled aft. 1322, m. Marie of Luxembourg, ABT 1323, m. Jeanne d’Evereux, 1325, d. 1 February 1328 in Vincennes, Val-de-Marne, France

Isabella "She-Wolf of France" of Hainault, b. 1295 in Paris, France, m. Edward II, King of England, ABT 26 January 1308 in Boulogne, France, d. 22 August 1358 in Castle Rising, Norfolk, England

Robert of France, b. 1297 in Paris, France, d. August 1308 in Saint-Germain-en-Laye, Yvelines, France

Philip III "the Bold", King of France

, b. 30 April 1245 in Poissy, Yvelines, France, d. 5 October 1285 in Perpignan, Languedoc-Roussillon, France

Father: Louis IX "Saint Louis", King of France, b. 25 April 1214 in Poissy, Yvelines, France, d. 25 August 1270 in Tunis, Tunisia, cause of death was dysentery

Mother: Margaret of Provence, b. 1221 in Forcalquier, Alpes-de-Haute-Provence, France, d. 20 December 1295 in Paris, France

Spouse: Isabella of Aragon, b. 1248, d. 28 January 1271, cause of death was injuries resulting from a fall from a horse and stillborn birth

Father: James I "the Conqueror", King of Aragon, b. 2 February 1208 in Montpellier, Languedoc-Roussillon, France, m. Eleanor of Castile, 1221

Mother: Yolanda (Violant) of Hungary, b. 1215, d. 1251

Married 28 May 1262

Children:

Louis of France, b. 1263/4, d. bef. May 1276 in Château de Vincennes, cause of death was possible poisoning by his stepmother Marie of Brabant

Philip IV "the Fair" or "the Iron King", King of France, b. April/June 1268 in Fontainebleau, France, m. Joan I of Navarre, 16 August 1284, d. 29 November 1314 in Fontainebleau, France

Robert of France, b. 1269, d. 1271

Charles, Count of Valois, b. 12 March 1270, m. Margaret, Countess of Anjou, 1290, m. Catherine of Courtenay, 28 February 1301 in Priory of St. Cloud, Paris, France, m. Mahaut of Châtillon, 1308, d. 16 December 1325 in Nogent-le-Roi, Eure-et-Loir, France

Stillborn son, b. 1271

Spouse: Marie of Brabant, b. 1256 in Louvaine, France, d. 12 January 1322 in Les Mureaux, France

Father: Henry III, Duke of Brabant

Mother: Alice (Adelaide) of Burgundy

Married 21 August 1274

Children:

Louis, Count of Évreux, b. 3 May 1276, m. Margaret of Artois, d. 19 May 1319 in Paris, France

Blanche of France, b. ABT 1278, m. Rudolph I of Bohemia, 25 May 1300, d. 1 March 1305 in Vienna, Austria

Margaret of France, b. 1282, m. Edward I "Longshanks", King of England, 8 September 1299 in Canterbury, Kent, England, d. 14 February 1318

Louis IX "Saint Louis", King of France

, b. 25 April 1214 in Poissy, Yvelines, France, d. 25 August 1270 in Tunis, Tunisia, cause of death was dysentery

Father: Louis VIII "The Lion", King of France, b. 5 September 1187 in Paris, France, d. 8 November 1226 Chateau de Montpensier, Auvergne, France, cause of death was dysentery

Mother: Blanche of Castile, b. 4 March 1188, d. 26 November 1252

Spouse: Margaret of Provence, b. 1221 in Forcalquier, Alpes-de-Haute-Provence, France, d. 20 December 1295 in Paris, France

Father: Ramon Berenguer IV, Count of Provence, b. 1198, d. 19 August 1245 in Aix-en-Provence, France

Mother: Beatrice of Savoy, b. 1205 in Chambery, Savoy, france, d. 4 January 1267 in Provence, France

Married 27 May 1234

Children:

Blanche of France, b. 1240, d. 29 April 1243

Isabella of France, b. 2 March 1241, m. Theobald II "the Young", King of Navarre, 6 April 1255, d. 17 April 1271 in Provence, France

Louis of France, b. 21/24 February 1244, d. 11 January 1260 in Paris, France

Philip III "the Bold", King of France, b. 30 April 1245 in Poissy, Yvelines, France, m. Isabella of Aragon, 28 May 1262, m. Marie of Brabant, 21 August 1274, d. 5 October 1285 in Perpignan, Languedoc-Roussillon, France

John of France, b. 1248, d. 1248

John Tristan, Count of Valois, b. 8 April 1250 in Damietta, Egypt, m. Yolanda II, Countess of Nevers, d. 3 August 1270 in Tunis, Tunisia, cause of death was dysentery

Peter, Count of Alençon, b. 1251 in the Holy Land, m. Joan of Châtillon, 1272, d. 6 April 1284 in Salerno, Italy

Blanche of France, b. 1253 in Jaffa, Israel, m. Ferdinand de la Cerda, November 1268, d. 1323 in Paris, France

Margaret of France, b. 1254, m. John I "the Victorious", Duke of Brabant, 5 September 1270, d. 1271, cause of death was complications from childbirth

Robert, Count of Clermont, b. 1256, m. Beatrice of Burgundy, d. 7 February 1317

Agnes of France, b. ABT 1260, m. Robert II, Duke of Burgundy, 1279, d. 19 December 1327 in Côte d’Or, Burgundy, France

Louis VIII "The Lion", King of France

, b. 5 September 1187 in Paris, France, d. 8 November 1226 Chateau de Montpensier, Auvergne, France, cause of death was dysentery

Father: Philip II Augustus, King of France, b. 21 August 1165 in Gonesse, France, m. Ingeborg (Isambour) of Denmark, 15 August 1193, annulled late 1193, reinstated 1200, d. 14 July 1223 in Mantes-le-Jolie, France

Mother: Isabelle of Hainaut, b. 5 April 1170 in Valenciennes, France, d. 15 March 1190 in Paris, France, cause of death was complications from childbirth.

Spouse: Blanche of Castile, b. 4 March 1188, d. 26 November 1252

Father: Alfonso VIII "the Noble", King of Castile, b. 11 November 1155 in Soria, Castile, Spain, d. 6 October 1214 in Gutierre Munoz, Avila, Castile, Spain, He became King of Castile, 1158 in Castile, Spain

Mother: Eleanor, Princess of England, b. 13 October 1162 in Domfront, Normandy, France, d. 25 October 1214 in Las Huelgas, Burgos, Spain

Married 23 May 1200

Children:

Blanche (possibly), b. 1205, died an infant

Philip, b. 9 September 1209, d. bef. July 1218

Alphonse, b. and d. 26 January 1213 in Lorrez-le-Bocage

John, b. and d. 26 January 1213 in Lorrez-le-Bocage

Louis IX "Saint Louis", King of France, b. 25 April 1214 in Poissy, Yvelines, France, m. Margaret of Provence, 27 May 1234, d. 25 August 1270 in Tunis, Tunisia, cause of death was dysentery

Robert I "The Good" of Artois, b. 25 September 1216, m. Matilda of Brabant, d. 12 February 1250 in Mansurrah, Egypt

Philip, b. 20 February 1218

John, Count of Anjou and Maine, b. 21 July 1219, d. 1232

Alphonse, Count of Poitou and Auvergne, b. 11 November 1220 in Poissy, France, d. 21 August 1271 in Corneto, France

Philip Dagobert, b. 20 February 1222, d. 1232

Isabelle, b. March 1224, d. 23 February 1270

Etienne, b. late 1225, d. early 1227

Charles, Count of Anjou and Maine (Charles I of Sicily), b. 21 March 1227 in France, m. Beatrice of Provence, 31 January 1246, m. Margaret of Burgundy, 1268, d. 7 January 1285 in Foggia, Naples, Italy

Philip II Augustus, King of France

, b. 21 August 1165 in Gonesse, France, m. Ingeborg (Isambour) of Denmark, 15 August 1193, annulled late 1193, reinstated 1200, d. 14 July 1223 in Mantes-le-Jolie, France

Father: Louis VII, King of France, b. ABT 1120 in Reims, Champagne, France, d. 18 September 1180 in Saint-Pont, Allier, Auvergne, France

Mother: Alix (Adele) of Champagne, b. ABT 1127 in Blois, France

Spouse: Isabelle of Hainaut, b. 5 April 1170 in Valenciennes, France, d. 15 March 1190 in Paris, France, cause of death was complications from childbirth.

Father: Baldwin V, Count of Hainaut, b. 1150, d. 17 December 1195

Mother: Margaret I, Countess of Flanders, b. ABT 1150, m. Ralph II, Count of Vermandois, 1160, d. 15 November 1194, bur. in St. Donatian's Cathedral, Bruges, Belgium

Married 28 April 1180 in Bapaume, France

Children:

Louis VIII "The Lion", King of France, b. 5 September 1187 in Paris, France, m. Blanche (Blanca) of Castile, 23 May 1200, d. 8 November 1226 Chateau de Montpensier, Auvergne, France, cause of death was dysentery

Robert, b. 14 March 1190, d. 18 March 1190

Philip, b. 14 March 1190, d. 18 March 1190

Spouse: Agnes of Merania, d. 1201 in Poissy, France

Father: Berthold IV, Duke of Merania, d. 12 August 1204

Mother: Agnes of Rochilitz, b. ABT 1160, d. 25 March 1195

Married 7 May 1196, separated 1200

Children:

Marie of France, Duchess of Brabant, b. 1198, m. Philip I "the Noble", Marquis of Namur, m. Henry I "the Courageous", Duke of Brabant, d. 15 August 1238

Philip I Hurepel, Count of Boulogne, b. September 1200, m. Matilda II, Countess of Boulogne, ABT 1223, d. 14/18 January 1234

Berthold IV, Duke of Merania

, d. 12 August 1204

Father: Berthold III, Count of Andechs

Mother: Hedwig of Wittelsbach

Spouse: Agnes of Rochilitz, b. ABT 1160, d. 25 March 1195

Father: Dedi III "the Fat", Margrave of Lusatia, b. ABT 1130, d. 16 August 1190, cause of death was a botched liposuction

Mother: Matilda of Heinzburg

Married ABT 1180

Children:

Otto I, Duke of Merania, b. ABT 1180, m. Beatrice II, Countess of Burgundy, 21 June 1208 in Bamberg, Bavaria, Germany, d. 7 May 1234 in Besançon, Burgundy, France

Ekbert, Bishop of Bamberg, d. 1237

Henry, Margrave of Istria and Carniola, m. Sophia of Weichselburg, d. 1228

Hedwig of Silesia, b. 1174 in Andechs, Bavaria, Germany, m. Henry I "the Bearded", Duke of Silesia, d. 15 October 1243 in Trzebnica Abbey, Silesia, Poland

Gertrude of Merania, b. 1185, m. Andrew II, King of Hungary, bef. 1203, d. 28 September 1213, cause of death was murder by Hungarian magnates

Agnes of Merania, m. Philip II Augustus, King of France, 7 May 1196, separated 1200, d. 1201 in Poissy, France

Berthold V, Count of Andechs, b. ABT 1180, d. 23 May 1251 in Aquileia, Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Italy

Matilda (Mechtild) of Merania, m. Engelbert III, Count of Gorizia, d. 1254

Berthold III, Count of Andechs

, b. 1110/22, d. 14 December 1188

Father: Berthold II, Count of Andechs, b. bef. 1099, m. Kunigunde of Formbach-Pitten, aft. 1132, d. 27 June 1151

Mother: Sophie of Istria, d. 1132

Spouse: Hedwig of Wittelsbach

Father: Otto IV, Count of Wittelsbach, Count Palatine of Bavaria, b. ABT 1183, d. 4 August 1156

Mother: Heilika of Pettendorf-Lengenfeld-Hopfenohe, b. ABT 1103, d. 14 September 1170

Married 1152

Children:

Berthold IV, Duke of Merania, m. Agnes of Rochilitz, ABT 1180, d. 12 August 1204

Sophia of Andechs, m. Poppo VI, Count of Henneberg, d. 1218

Kunigunde of Andechs, m. Eberhard, Count of Eberstein, d. aft. 1207

Matilda, Countess of Pisino, m. Berthold, Margrave of Vohburg, m. Engelbert III, Count of Gorizia, ABT 1190, d. 1245

Spouse: Luitgard of Denmark

Father: Sweyn III Grathe, King of Denmark

Mother: Adela of Meissen

Married ABT 1180

Children:

Poppo, Bishop of Bamberg, d. 2 December 1245

Berta, Abbess of Gerbstadt, d. 1190

Berthold II, Count of Andechs

, b. bef. 1099, d. 27 June 1151

Father: Arnold, Count of Diessen

Mother: Gisela of Schweinfurt

Berthold's parentage is speculation, so I have not continued the line past this point.

Spouse: Sophie of Istria, d. 1132

Father: Poppo II, Margrave of Istria, d. 1098

Mother: Richgard of Sponheim

Married

Children:

Poppo of Andechs, d. 1148

Berthold III, Count of Andechs, b. 1110/22, m. Hedwig of Wittelsbach, 1152, m. Luitgard of Denmark, ABT 1180, d. 14 December 1188

Otto, Bishop of Brixen and Bamberg, d. 1196

Gisela of Andechs, m. Diepold II, Count of Berg-Schlklingen, d. aft. 1150

Spouse: Kunigunde of Formbach-Pitten

Father: Egbert II, Count of Formbach-Pitten

Married aft. 1132

Children:

Mechtildis, Abbess of Edelstetten Abbey, d. 1160

Euphemia, Abbess of Altmünster Abbey, d. 1180

Kunigunde of Andechs, d. 1139 as a nun at Admont Abbey

Poppo II, Margrave of Istria

, d. 1098

Father: Ulrich I, Margrave of Carniola, d. 6 March 1070

Mother: Sophia of Hungary, b. ABT 1050, d. 18 June 1095

He was also Count of Weimar-Orlamünda, Margrave of Carniola, and Margrave of Istria.

Spouse: Richgard of Sponheim

Father: Engelbert, Count of Sponheim, d. 1 April 1096

Married

Children:

Sophie of Istria, m. Berthold II, Count of Andechs, d. 1132

Hedwig of Istria, m. Herman I, Count of Winzenburg, m. Adalbert II, Count of Bogen

Ulrich I, Margrave of Carniola

, d. 6 March 1070

Father: Poppo I, Margrave of Carniola, d. 13 July bef. 1044

Mother: Hadamut of Friuli

He was also Count of Weimar-Orlamünda, Margrave of Carniola, and Margrave of Istria.

Spouse: Sophia of Hungary, b. ABT 1050, m. Magnus, Duke of Burgundy, d. 18 June 1095

Father: Béla I, King of Hungary, b. bef. 1020, d. 11 September 1063 at Kinizsa Creek, Hungary

Mother: Richeza Mieszkavna of Poland, b. ABT 1014

Married

Children:

Poppo II, Margrave of Istria, m. Richgard of Sponheim, d. 1098

Ulric II, Margrave of Carniola, m. Adelaide of Thuringia, d. 13 May 1112

Richgard of Carniola, m. Eckhard I, Count of Scheyern, m. Otto II, Count of Scheyern, maybe

Adelaide of Carniola, m. Frederick, Vogt of Regensburg, m. Udalshalk, Count in the Lurngau

Poppo I, Margrave of Carniola

, d. 13 July bef. 1044

Father: William II "the Great", Count of Weimar, b. ABT 930/5, d. 24 December 1003

He was also known as Boppo and was Count of Weimar-Orlamünda, Margrave of Carniola, and Margrave of Istria.

Spouse: Hadamut of Friuli

Father: Werigand, Count of Friuli and Istria

Married

Children:

Ulrich I, Margrave of Carniola, m. Sophia of Hungary, d. 6 March 1070

William II "the Great", Count of Weimar

, b. ABT 930/5, d. 24 December 1003

Father: William I, Count of Weimar, d. 16 April 963

Children:

William III of Weimar, m. Bertha, m. Oda of Lusatia, d. 16 April 1039

Poppo I, Margrave of Carniola, m. Hadamut of Friuli, d. 13 July bef. 1044

Agnes of Weimar, m. Frederick I, Count Palatine of Saxony, possibly

William I, Count of Weimar

, d. 16 April 963

William may have been married to a daughter of Poppo II, Duke of Thuringia. He was the first recorded count of Weimar.

Children:

William II "the Great", Count of Weimar, b. ABT 930/5, d. 24 December 1003

Poppo of Weimar

Sigbert of Weimar

Otto IV, Count of Wittelsbach, Count Palatine of Bavaria

, b. ABT 1183, d. 4 August 1156

Father: Otto III, Count of Scheyern and Wittelsbach

He was also Otto IV of Scheyern and V of Wittelsbach.

Spouse: Heilika of Pettendorf-Lengenfeld-Hopfenohe, b. ABT 1103, d. 14 September 1170, bur. Ensdorf Abbey, Ensdorf, Bavaria, Germany

Father: Frederick III of Pettendorf-Lengenfeld-Hopfenohe, d. 1112/9

Mother: Hedwig-Eilika of Swabia, b. 1088, d. 1110

Married 13 July 1116

Children:

Herman of Wittelsbach

Otto I "the Redhead", Duke of Bavaria, b. 1117 in Kelheim, Bavaria, Germany, m. Agnes of Loon, d. 11 July 1183 in Pfullendorf, Baden-Württemberg, Germany

Conrad, Archbishop of Mainz, b. 1120/25, d. 25 October 1200 in Riedfeld, Hungary

Frederick II, Count of Wittelsbach, m. Daughter of Donauwörth, 1184, d. 1198/9

Udalrich of Wittelsbach, d. 29 May 1179

Otto VII, Count of Wittelsbach, m. Benedicta of Donauwörth, d. 1189

Hedwig of Wittelsbach, m. Berthold III, Count of Andechs

Adelaide of Wittelsbach, m. Otto II of Stefling

Otto III, Count of Scheyern and Wittelsbach

Father: Eckhard I, Count of Scheyern, d. 20 June bef. 1088

Mother: Richgard of Carniola

Children:

Otto IV, Count of Wittelsbach, Count Palatine of Bavaria, b. ABT 1183, m. Heilika of Pettendorf-Lengenfeld-Hopfenohe, 13 July 1116, d. 4 August 1156

Eckhard I, Count of Scheyern

, d. 20 June bef. 1088

Father: Otto I, Count of Scheyern, b. ABT 1020, m. Haziga of Diessen, m. Daughter of Reichersbeuern, d. bef. 4 December 1072

Spouse: Richgard of Carniola

Father: Ulrich I, Margrave of Carniola, d. 6 March 1070

Mother: Sophia of Hungary, b. ABT 1050, d. 18 June 1095

Married

Children:

Udalrich I, Count of Scheyern

Otto III, Count of Scheyern and Wittelsbach

Otto I, Count of Scheyern

, b. ABT 1020, d. 4 December 1072 on pilgrimage to Jerusalem

Father: Heinrich I, Count in the Pegnitz

Mother: Daughter of Kuno I, Count of Altdorf

Spouse: Daughter of Reichersbeuern

Father: Meginhardt , Count of Reichersbeuern

Married

Children:

Eckhard I, Count of Scheyern, m. Richgard of Carniola, d. 20 June bef. 1088

Bernard I, Count of Scheyern, d. ABT 2 March 1102

Spouse: Haziga of Diessen, b. ABT 1040, m. Herman, Count of Kastl, d. 1 August 1104

Father: Frederick II, Count of Diessen

Married ABT 1057

Children:

Otto II, Count of Scheyern, m. Richgard of Carniola, maybe, d. 31 October 1120

Arnold I, Count of Scheyern, d. ABT 1123

Frederick III of Pettendorf-Lengenfeld-Hopfenohe

, d. 1112/9

Spouse: Hedwig-Eilika of Swabia, b. 1088, d. 1110

Father: Frederick I, Duke of Swabia, b. ABT 1050, d. bef. 21 July 1105

Mother: Agnes of Germany, b. 1074 in Klosterneuburg, Niederösterreich, Austria, m. Leopold III "The Saint", 1106 in Germany, d. 24 September 1143 in Austria

Married

Children:

Heilika of Pettendorf-Lengenfeld-Hopfenohe, b. ABT 1103, m. Otto IV, Count of Wittelsbach, Count Palatine of Bavaria, d. 14 September 1170

Dedi III "the Fat", Margrave of Lusatia

, b. ABT 1130, d. 16 August 1190, cause of death was a botched liposuction

Father: Conrad I "the Great", Margrave of Meissen

Mother: Luitgard of Elchingen-Ravenstein

Spouse: Matilda of Heinzburg

Married

Children:

Dietrich, Count of Sommerschenburg and Groitzsch, b. bef. 13 September 1159, d. 13 June 1207

Philip, Provost of Xanten, d. 1190

Henry of Lusatia, d. 1174

Goswin of Lusatia, d. 1174
